intro: Fernseea bocainensis f. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved form of the Bocainensis fern, is a rare and distinctive fern species native to specific regions of Brazil. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its compact, densely packed fronds. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with short, broad, and often dark green leaves that are densely arranged along the rhizome. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in humid tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
